text_a: Hit is two and fourti winter þei seiȝen
Now I þonke my lord seide Ioseph
text_b: þat lente me of his grace

text_a: þei folewen him and his wyf
In þe nome of þe fader
And hedde I-turned to þe feyþ
¶ Siþen he fette his fader with a ferde
ÞEn com a vois to Ioseph
And alle þat þey mouȝten gete
¶ In þe morwe he was sone boun
He þat ledes vs þis wei
ÞEnne spekes a vois to Ioseph
Forte do in þat ilke blod
¶ whon þe lust speke with me
And bote þou and þi sone
And Iosep[h] walk in þe world

text_b: þe blod he with him fonges

text_a: and in þe nome of þe fader
He seiȝ þe kyng þer he sat
text_b: and wuste þat he was wraþþed

text_a: For he and þo of Egipte
he wolde haue red of his folk
þat was ded on þe cros
I am not worþi to seyn
¶ þou schewest A symple skil quaþ þe kyng
to speke of A ded mon
¶ I schal sei ou quod Ioseph
And seide Blessed beo þou flour

text_b: hou scholde I gon with childe

text_a: ¶ þou schalt be mayden for him
And vche put him in hond
He lette sle for his sake
þat weore I-slawe for his sake
Bote þorwȝ þe grace of him-self
His Mooder ay with him fleih
¶ Whon he com in-to þe lond

text_b: and bren hem al to pouder

text_a: Hou scholde a child come forþ
And I schal preue þe tale
¶ whon god sat in his blisse
He seiȝ þe peple þorw peine
And þou seist now he has on
þat he nas god ay forþ
¶ I sei þe Fader was God
Bote as hit com heom to mouþ
Bote þe kuynde of his Fader
Bote he was gostliche of Fader
So þat he com twies forþ
¶ þou toldest furst of his Fader
¶ Ȝe sire bote I pertly vndo
þat he nas euere of o miȝt
¶ þe ky[n]g bi-heold on his face
He* hedde I-ben of heiȝ blod
þow semest not ful good clerk
þe tale is heiȝ in him-self
Hit is ful þester to me
I may not wel lenge now
þow schalt haue liueraunce of In
¶ I haue felauschupe wiþ-outen seis Ioseph
¶ þe kyng lette fette hem forþ
I trouwe þat beo þi sone

text_b: for soþe as I þe telle

text_a: ¶ þe þridde How God scholde wiþ-outen wem
¶ Þenne he seih in his chaumbre-flor
Bote þe bark of þat on
þen ouþer of þe oþer two

text_b: and bad him not ben ferd
þei mihte not seo þe heiȝþe

text_a: On vche braunche was a word

notes: sole instance of this spelling for SEE

text_a: ¶ And þis saues quaþ þat wiht
¶ þe kyng nuste wel forte seye
¶ þenne he seiȝ a newe chaumbre-wouh
Bote ȝif I turne him bi þis poynt

text_b: as þou art ful of Ioye

text_a: þat speke to hem of Israel
And wustest daniel in þe put
Go þou most to þi wyf
A child Galaad schal be hoten
And he dos as he bad
¶ In þe morwe he was vppe
And he tolde hem of his crucifiing
Er þei speeken to me feire
Bote beo ȝe stable in oure fei
for ȝe han more of þe lawe
¶ I nul not fastenen on þe sone
but elles vche mon of þe
¶ þat on beres in his hond
¶ þat oþer beres in his hond
¶ And þe Fyfþe a blodi cloþ
Eft he bad him rise vp
In his honden and his feet
¶ þenne þei loken in atte wȝucche
And eiþer bar in his hond
¶ þen com on þe strengþe of god
¶ Ihesu made for to greiþe Iosaphe
And tolde him of his vestimens
In vche Cite þere he come

text_b: and do hem vp to holde

text_a: ¶ Bi þat was A Messager come
whon þei comen to þe halle
on hem of þe verrey cros
¶ þe kyng hedde geten him a clerk
to take Ioseph in his tale
¶ þou toldest me ȝusterday quod þe kyng
I seie þat on is also good
¶ þat on is a verrei god
þat al þi reume schal seo

text_b: þat þou weore wont to hunte

text_a: nou schal winne his wille of þe
his eiȝen flowen out of his hed

text_b: for sake* [MS forsake as in 1 185] of þis oþer

text_a: And beo þe miht of Iubiter
weore eny of heom so wood
And what trouwest þou of þis mon

text_b: and towen him to þe temple

text_a: and wol not onswere a word
he may not speke a word
and þe fend of his bodi
¶ þe kyng bowes to his pors
For and þou profre him eny
¶ Do tel me seis þe kyng
¶ Se ȝe not þe tweyne Angeles

text_b: for us ne schalt þou wonde

text_a: Of newe þing þat is to come he seis
Bi þat was a Messager i-come
þer is non in þat lond
forsoþe A mon was þi fader
þou wast lenged in þe lond
¶ For þou were a feir child
¶ þei heolden þe of herre blod
So þou come to þe kyng
And þou weore a ȝong mon
forþi he ȝaf þe þis lond
Hit is not allynge to carpe sire kyng

text_b: bote askes him of þe sweuene

text_a: þat he mette on þe niht
text_b: and bad he scholde him telle

text_a: þou miht haue more redi roume
for þer scholde no mon verreili
þat he nis saaf þat dai
ÞEnne he buskes touward þe bente

text_b: þat tyme hit was non oþer

text_a: þat þei come to a Castel
¶ þe kyng was gon to pleye him
He seide my ladi þe queene
¶ Forþi heo wole þat he wite
¶ Ho has witered hire of þis

text_b: I trouwe hit be þer a|boute

text_a: bi þat þe niȝt was a-weye
text_b: And þe day on þe morwe

text_a: He mihte neuer gete loue of þe kyng
He seide my ladi þe Qwene
Ȝif euere I halp hire at neode
And I am come to þi wille
For euere þe kuynde wol be frend
Now þei bouwe touward þe bente
þat þorw him reowen no res
He hedde an hache vppon heiȝ
þat luyte miȝte faren him fro
¶ þo þat hulden hem on fote
þei mihten haue do muche harm
¶ þenne com on wiþ a tale
¶ Seraphe was of hem wel war
He mette a gome on an hors
wiþ þe deþ in his hals

text_b: þat to him he ne mihte

text_a: And he nedde bote fourti men
He seiȝ a child strauȝt þer-on
And he bi-souȝte him of grace
¶ þenne he seiȝ a whit kniht
A red cros on his scheld
Baar him doun of his hors
fel hem feiȝe to his feet

text_b: and seiȝ him wiþ þat ilke
to take him bi þe bridel

text_a: ¶ þe white kniht wiþ his swerd
vppon an hole of his helm
þer nas no lynde so liht
and I schal note hit to-day
¶ Haue her-on seis þe white kniht
whon he hedde hit in honde
Nas þer ȝong mon ne old
Hit falles not for to seiȝe
and seis þei ben a-middes þe Reume
ne heo knowe not in the lond
¶ þenne þe folk of þe Roche

text_b: þow schalt wiþ me to court

text_a: þei tolde me of vche a poynt
Hou trouwestou of my lord heo seis
Ȝe þorw þe miht of god
¶ Ȝe I wol bi-hote þe heer
whon þat my lord is comen
¶ I wole my trouþe þe bi-take
Nay þou hast non seis he
Ȝe han be fastned wiþ hem
¶ I am sinful as þou he seis
¶ No mak þi preyere to him heo seis
¶ woldestou leeue vppon him he seis
¶ He made hire to knele a-doun
And heo was lihtned of hire euel
And seide his bert was so hor
text_b: I bad not on him leeue

text_a: as my broþer is at home
þat þou miȝt seo him þi-self
And a wynt and a sauor
we weore so wel of vr-self
He is so feol in him-self

text_b: hou euel he was to torne

text_a: Now þe kyng comes to sarras
As sone as he com hom
he þat halp þe wiþ sound
ÞEnne com on fro þe fiht
was striken of þat on Arm
text_b: and bar hit in þat oþer

text_a: ¶ þen Ioseph asked þe kynges scheld
In þe nome of þe fader
he was þe forme þat day
Heom þouȝte he leomede as liht
ÞEnne com he wiþ þe sore Arm
text_b: þat þorw þe grace was holpen

text_a: In þe nome of þe fader
In þe nome of þe fader
He tok a basin of gold

text_a: ¶ while þat he and Naciens gon
And þei lenden of þe toun
